2E342F340A374EA4895E016C40FCAF4F.description: Describe various treatment options that might be considered at various stages of a specific pathology from the perspective of Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and/or alternative approaches to health care.

C9E676766F9649C19114C733316648C7.description: Describe some treatment options (e.g., dialysis, radiation therapy, surgery and organ transplantation) which have been designed to address specific health care issues.

FFC8FE07563D4C02AED5888616915C02.description: Discuss possible implications (e.g., incorrect diagnosis, improper treatment and psychological effect on patient) associated with incorrect interpretation of diagnostic findings for the patient and others.

EC6CBA16091E4F01A72D82AB65CE8A40.description: Explain why medical practitioners often use multiple tools and procedures to establish a medical diagnosis.

2088C19BD67D422E8F7A8ED2DBFEA97D.description: Interpret diagnostic results and choose an appropriate course of action based on participation in a role-play, simulation and/or case study.

55620275529A4ED6BAE1FD9007B80643.description: Suggest explanations based on interpretation of data from diagnostic assessment tools (e.g., identifying a broken bone in an X-ray, ultrasound of a pregnancy to determine number of fetuses and identifying high blood pressure based on given values).

600D350AF86E4C058AE6D8A6AAF38DEB.description: Identify tools and procedures that may be used to assist health care providers in monitoring the progression of a specific pathology.

385D01AFABFC430E860BE91C79B1B111.description: Assess the importance of interpreting diagnostic findings to support treatment options for specific pathologies.

987E217593B74C10896C3994F2C4BB99.description: Discuss the importance of diagnosis in improving the care of patients, protecting the health of clients and improving the economics of health care.

B1335C03CF2E4EC9B45103604036EAC3.description: Identify differences in tools and procedures used in diagnosing illness from the perspectives of Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care.

B804623DA0A34A21B4F3B378C31C2B7D.description: Discuss the responsibility, including preparation and expectations, of the patient in diagnostic and imaging procedures.

C9198910310E43A69112F90E75C30117.description: Discuss factors (e.g., severity of illness, dose received, cost and availability) that influence the choice to use a diagnostic tool or procedure.

621DBFF68B8F403983B80214E3623DD8.description: Describe technological advances in medical imaging tools (e.g., X-ray, ultrasound, computerized tomography and magnetic resonance imaging).

65DB9B393A9042469C58E800134B0D9F.description: Research the operation, risks, benefits and imaging modalities (e.g., sound, light, radiation and nuclear medicine) of medical imaging tools, including X-ray radiography, magnetic resonance imaging [MRI], computed tomography [CT], ultrasound and positron emission tomography [PET]).

D6726790E6F141AEBABCF268A642B001.description: Explain the procedures, safety concerns and relevance of common laboratory tests (e.g., blood testing, blood glucose, culture swabs, urinalysis, stool, biopsy and microscopy) used in medical diagnosis.

7264C20F00EE4AF8970C58AECF2ECCE2.description: Measure and record vital signs (e.g., pulse, respiration, temperature, blood pressure and degree of pain) of self and/or others.

748E77F70240424BB5CDA1B2ADFE6DC4.description: Identify examples of procedures (e.g., visual inspection) and tools (e.g., stethoscope, octoscope and sphygmomanometer) commonly used for non-invasive diagnostic observations in health care.

B821846D4C7040ECA594A85F7259C8EF.description: Assess the significance of monitoring vital signs in health care, including obtaining accurate medical history and patient perception of pain.

EB31412F2BF1490BBCF5FF61B5D44B2C.description: Explore the tools and procedures used to diagnose and monitor medical conditions.

2F5CE7BAF12F4EE68493DE015323CBC9.description: Examine how various eating practices (e.g., pre-contact First Nations and Métis, kosher, halal and fasting practices during observances such as Lent and Ramadan) are based upon cultural and religious beliefs.

6E076EA4E1B44313969608AFCA12BB98.description: Assess whether eating practices such as carbohydrate loading, fad diets, vegetarianism, veganism, fast food, energy drinks, 100-mile diet and fasting provide sufficient nutrition to support healthy functioning.

814CC6ABE3E443DB8A57E7193CDBE730.description: Evaluate physiological and psychological effects of nutritional disorders such as anorexia nervosa, bulimia and obesity and their connection to body image and nutrition deficiencies.

48F506AF34164EB6941F7C495519C26F.description: Investigate the effects of processed foods, nutrition supplements, growth hormones, genetically modified foods and food additives (e.g., caffeine, aspartame, food coloring and monosodium glutamate [MSG]) on human health.

404194D1A06740A892B28A1D6D5FEBF4.description: Critique the use of tools (e.g., body mass index [BMI], skinfold caliper, BOD POD and hydrostatic weighing) that provide information about body composition.

A9502D1A74C54444A57891898BACB763.description: Design a healthful diet based on personal lifestyle choices.

31DBB4211DD54DEF807AC7BC86AD2C64.description: Assess the value of information from food labels (e.g., ingredient list, nutrition facts table, nutrient content claims and health claims) to guide personal food choices.

489D3F8FC6DF4E82807DE0205FA0CF16.description: Examine how the dietary recommendations in Canada’s Food Guide compare with recommendations in food guides from other countries.

BD2DFD54E47E4AD19EE7CB4BADF4F787.description: Explain how analysis of excrement (e.g., Bristol stool chart) and urine (e.g., urine analysis by color, clarity, odor, pH, nitrites, protein, glucose, tinkle test and Pee-O-Meter) serve as indicators of healthy functioning.

00A8C65F605D4DEF88D4783CE07D3863.description: Compare results of personal macronutrient intake to recommended daily intake (RDI) values.

94E9876116E34C538B23A1FDEAB9BD50.description: Calculate personal energy requirements and record personal caloric and macronutrient intake for a specified period.

85348F39531341FA8DB20A3251F8023A.description: Explain how various factors (e.g., activity level, muscle mass, gender, age, weight and height) affect personal energy requirements.

AC75D51D05E444ABB0192BEC1F42EB7A.description: Pose questions about the role of nutrition in supporting healthy eating practices.

E7301432640D4584A059A64189C1DF3F.description: Analyze dietary choices based on personal and cultural beliefs and scientific understanding of nutrition.

96CC2D8233504878B71138329BE62893.description: Explain the role of adenosine triphosphate (ATP) as a molecule indispensable for the functioning of cells and life.

8E9C8A43A7DF492C994647355FAE9834.description: Investigate the contributions of various people (e.g., Justus von Liebig, Antoine-Laurent Lavoisier, Claude Bernard and Emil Fischer) in advancing scientific understanding of nutrition.

BDC6B51063494B179E5C0B2C6DE31560.description: Examine the connection between undernutrition or overnutrition and development of diseases such as anemia, scurvy, Type 2 diabetes and heart disease.

8B1EDC04016846F8A380D55614E4D0FE.description: Research the food source and health claims associated with various phytochemicals (e.g., carotenoids, flavonoids, phenolic acids, phytoestrogens and organosulphur compounds).

B8CDB9766AE94928B1C890E9702C4B2C.description: Explain how micronutrients (e.g., vitamins A, B, C, D, E and K, and iron, calcium and phosphorous) are necessary for health.

EBAE70A79B624BCA97CD5FB7BB30A599.description: Establish the relationships between dehydration synthesis and hydrolysis reactions in relation to the macronutrients (e.g., glucose + fructose = sucrose).

20F8E2FAD3AA4B8AB8B69D6A5A60ECA3.description: Recognize issues (e.g., hypo/hyperglycemia, high/low cholesterol and denaturation of proteins) that may arise when macromolecules disrupt homeostasis.

EB7226DF92BC4A31A6523C6A2904681F.description: Investigate how enzymes (e.g., amylase, pepsin, lipase and protease) found in the mouth, stomach, pancreas and small intestine aid in the chemical digestion of food.

347E6A85E3244754A4EF40CB5FA1632C.description: Describe the role of proteins in the production of antibodies, hemoglobin and insulin, structural support and building and maintaining muscle.

12DD83EB329B48C78D2E13FDE4C2BBE9.description: Explain the roles of low-density lipoprotein (LDL) and high-density lipoprotein (HDL) in managing cholesterol levels.

0D9A1CDE3F4C43838CC532EEA870E792.description: Investigate the role of fats (e.g., saturated, unsaturated and trans fats) in processes such as long term energy storage, supporting vitamin absorption, creating cell membranes, synthesizing hormones, cushioning and protecting organs and helping us feel full.

DDF4F6385B02489A88AA46A655264FB6.description: Explore how the body breaks down and uses simple (e.g., monosaccharide and disaccharide) and complex (i.e., polysaccharide) carbohydrates and dietary fiber.

8DF2BA9AE8EE4798B890DF851497E9C1.description: Identify which macronutrients and micronutrients are commonly found in each food group (i.e., vegetables and fruit, grain products, milk and alternatives, meat and alternatives and oils and fats).

D2C7277F57BF4221800CDC5857989C37.description: Assess the importance of macronutrients (i.e., carbohydrates, proteins and fats) and micronutrients (e.g., vitamins, minerals and phytochemicals) in maintaining human health.

1A3C2ADE898047859FFEDEC316E1D5B6.description: Analyze the role of homeostasis in various phenomena such as regulation, heart rate, breathing, urination, sweating, digestion, body temperature, blood composition and stress.

F254FBD6CB544C0BB7B6C67C7CE48716.description: Compare how bacteria (e.g., Salmonella, Streptococcus, and Escherichia coli) and viruses (e.g., common cold, influenza and herpes) differ in how they are transmitted, their impact on the human body and how each is treated.

BA981524DF61444C92AA1AC2D2772A72.description: Compare prepared slides or digital images of healthy and diseased tissues to identify how pathologies affect cells.

F2B1142141FB462B8FD6A5DF471C4605.description: Outline the history of a disease or illness and its causes, including societal and cultural perspectives.

7DC8D01D742B4ADAB9CD9DFCFA85C5C7.description: Create a representation (e.g., illness narrative, journal, timeline, story, video or diorama) of the progression of a specific pathology from the perspective of a real or hypothetical individual, including impacts on their lifestyle.

6CF6CD3EDB68425FB7ECCFD2A00B86D6.description: Research the symptoms, possible causes, stages and scope (e.g., cells, tissues, organs and/or systems) of a pathology that affects one or more body systems.

CC90D703304B40159D1B26EFAF60D803.description: Investigate how the immune system uses a layered defense to respond to pathogens, including the difference between the innate and adaptive immune system.

21604734CCCD4C319F5261A222138392.description: Differentiate among the ways in which medical practitioners and the public use terms such as disease, illness, ailment, disorder, infection, medical condition, syndrome and abnormal condition.

F24D2DB8F8C84042AA24053DCE201A28.description: Investigate the effects of various injuries, disorders and diseases on human cells, tissues, organs and systems.

5AA0B2B08A1D4E4BBA355D53B70F7CFA.description: Research advances in scientific understanding of human anatomy and physiology.

5DA2AF08C14644759D82A9739AD5A405.description: Investigate the benefits of normal flora, or normal microbiota, on and in the human body

DACB59444D8340A291965425619826F4.description: Discuss the interrelationships between the ABO and Rh blood group systems, an individual’s blood type and blood donor compatibilities.

A5C01E25E7EF4FC4A38A815D4ECEC796.description: Design and carry out an investigation to examine baseline values used for assessing health such as heart rate, O2 saturation, blood pressure, temperature and respiratory rate.

EF98D113E2894247A126B122ABA27B6C.description: Investigate the anatomical locations of organs in mammals such as pigs, rats or cats through dissection or virtual simulation.

7F8712BE2287458EBB0407D65ABB4DD6.description: Use anatomical terminology, including directional terms, body planes, body regions and body cavities, to locate human anatomical features based on standard anatomical position.

4B632824F61A4C1CA5979A50AB299822.description: Identify the normal values or ranges for the common vital signs (e.g., heart rate, blood pressure, body temperature, O2 saturation and respiratory rate) of a healthy human.

3C4AFBB3BFAA4EB39E49C59B195DA5A2.description: Describe the anatomy (structure) and physiology (function) of at least five human body systems (i.e., cardiovascular, endocrine, lymphatic, digestive, urinary, muscular, nervous, respiratory, reproductive, integumentary and skeletal).

FD555B75C5EB4C5DBED8C3E25FE04F00.description: Examine First Nations, Métis and other holistic perspectives of the human body.

55EE1E9F12B6492A823508348FBF96B3.description: Analyze the anatomy and physiology of a healthy human.

02D1C2E258C447F78D1EE3DDCF1A4323.description: Debate a decision related to ethics in health care from the viewpoint of individuals who hold different belief systems.

13C06B1D9A54425EA29C46E804B43A5B.description: Assess how various ethical considerations (e.g., personal beliefs, informed consent, the roles of institutional review boards and regulatory agencies) may influence an individual’s decision to participate in a clinical study of a new biomedical intervention (e.g., vaccine, drug, treatment, device or process).

1C3F96D19D83429BB71AC94365379242.description: Recognize the importance of considering linguistic and cultural needs when providing health care services

6171A4D8AB204ECFB2F9B359E2233E68.description: Understand a patient’s rights in Saskatchewan and in Canada concerning health care decisions such as developing an advance care directive, refusal of treatment, informed consent and the role of a proxy or substitute decisionmaker.

9FDB0A9F29BF40778A691719CD368162.description: Examine ethical considerations and perspectives related to issues such as the use of cadavers in professional studies, dissection and raising animals for the purpose of dissection, and public exhibits of plastinated organs and bodies, all of which could provide increased scientific understanding of human anatomy.

03DA053C6A1E40D89D0B3146D4958F4C.description: Discuss individual, community and cultural beliefs regarding issues related to life and death such as home birthing, blood transfusions, contraception, abortions, organ donation, autopsies, euthanasia, cremation, burials and medical aid in dying.

5CB48AFBA9FC457D967F48C9D2FF560E.description: Examine ethical considerations related to various practices and treatments (e.g., chemotherapy, radiation, acupuncture, sweat lodge, blood transfusions, herbal remedies and hirudotherapy) that might be considered in Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care.

DDAD13F9AEA646268C09999F1E6B9334.description: Contrast how procedures to prevent illness, such as immunizations, vitamin supplements, physical activity, nutrition and prayer, might be viewed from the perspective of Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care.

4C78D4C4014247FB9AED9F80283A49BE.description: Analyze a health care issue with respect to the core ethical questions.

4E0E0CA6B66444DA96B82DB74385DAF1.description: Understand the core ethical questions to be considered  when making health care decisions: What can be done for the patient? (intervention technologies), Does the patient understand the options? (informed consent),  What does the patient want? (autonomy), What are the benefits? (beneficence), Will it harm the patient? (non-maleficence), Are the patient’s requests fair and able to be satisfied? (justice), Are the costs involved fair to society? (economic consequences)

4518D63A99E54BBFBD01767490E2CAC5.description: Pose questions about ethical dilemmas within health care.

C278A6D4B1CD4590BDC42CD58555D1E3.description: Examine how personal, cultural and societal beliefs affect ethical decisions regarding health care.

C85E38E55BAF48A788499E1DD577FD06.description: Discuss potential health hazards or complications that may arise from combining different approaches to health care to address an individual’s health concerns.

9C6749ED915043389BDF7FB23E7BC617.description: Provide examples of how one or more of the major approaches to health care might be implemented together to support the health and wellbeing of an individual from mental, emotional, physical and spiritual perspectives.

31FE5A90ACAD43AA954761EA6214FE5D.description: Assess the importance of clinical trial features (e.g., informed consent, randomized control trial, blind and double-blind protocols and placebos) in providing reliable scientific evidence to support Western approaches to health care.

F317DCB3ECB340BEA8171AA1F1DCDA5E.description: Examine the significance of rituals, place-based ceremonies, plants, and traditional herbs in Indigenous and traditional approaches to health care.

01E98F74EE394FAFBC6074667F71824E.description: Investigate the intended results of using natural products (e.g., herbs, vitamins, minerals, probiotics, and essential oils), mind and body practices (e.g., acupuncture, various massage therapies, yoga, spinal manipulation, relaxation techniques, meditation, and movement therapies) and other complementary and/or alternative approaches to health care.

310BA697D8274073AE05EA836BFD2544.description: Research the costs associated with various approaches to health care and the health benefits available to residents of Saskatchewan and Canada.

37067EFE73BE457491948B2B9BBD3A00.description: Identify where Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care are offered in your community and elsewhere in Saskatchewan.

AEB7AE6C174C40C1B16ED0143ECF15F7.description: Assess how practitioners of Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care address health, wellness, illness, disease, and treatment through beliefs and practices such as Circle of Life, disharmony of body energies, being symptom free and healthy lifestyle choices. (

09E77A65CE854E62B5D3409917E180FA.description: Discuss the importance of and difficulties in defining terms such as Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care within a global context

C7D34B798F9740A7B9B3ED96A7D06B4B.description: Identify how humanity’s beliefs about health, wellness, illness, disease and treatment have changed over time.

9CE40C3C52294D8986C7560072D1F1A9.description: Analyze how Western, Indigenous, traditional, complementary and alternative approaches to health care can contribute to a holistic (e.g., mental, emotional, physical and spiritual) perspective of health.

5735EE9626F14754A4FA58209536D586.description: Construct a tool (e.g., rubric, checklist, self-evaluation form or peer-evaluation form) to assess the process and products involved in a student-directed study.

564A76FD45F74A919931B085183FA842.description: Share the results of student-directed research through a display, presentation, performance, demonstration, song, game, commercial, fine art representation or research paper.

9AAFF76A5F0C46D18E37BB876796A2DA.description: Create a personal medical history, incorporating information such as family history, baseline data and immunizations.

561096441CF24E96BED5BBA741CD5BE5.description: Develop a case study of the progression and/or treatment of a specific pathology from the perspective of a Western, traditional, complementary and/or alternative approach to health care.

313427ABE5DA40579C14B914CDC89F3E.description: Develop a case study that exemplifies ethical decision making in health care.

6A6DE4DD5C284B5DAAEA8960EEBFC99A.description: Debate an issue related to health science, including developing materials to support the arguments for and against a position.

DC8C2E0D99054BF5A3986EF9ABE7B7DF.description: Design, construct and evaluate the effectiveness of a device, model or technique that demonstrates the scientific principles underlying a concept related to a Health Science 20 topic.

30BF86EEB1F5473098FCCF95B3801DF6.description: Assemble and reflect on a portfolio that demonstrates understanding of a health science topic of interest to the student.

803A184AB5A54868AFB50945B59ABC6A.description: Carry out an experiment following established scientific protocols to investigate a question of interest related to one or more of the topics of Health Science 20.

26949C01ECCF4ABF97B728C11BF45F1E.description: Design a scientific investigation related to a topic of study in Health Science 20 that includes a testable question, a hypothesis, an experimental design that will test the hypothesis and detailed procedures for collecting and analyzing data.

94AA6C5FBF0C4FEB92F4761E5647E8B3.description: Create and carry out a plan to explore one or more topics of personal interest relevant to Health Science 20 in depth.

7E0174EC3DBD4ADFAFF71D827DD1FF16.description: Use acquired knowledge to develop a plan to attain a job of the student’s interest in the health science field.

C71CB441119F4D19B92A8757C618E823.description: Communicate research findings related to health-science occupations through a display, brochure, video, presentation software, website or orally.

1EC9BD93B48B46C599B3D6D2A220D2A6.description: Assess the role of a volunteer, the importance of volunteerism and potential local opportunities to volunteer in the health sector.

65F37D731A3342BC8E891ED526889E5B.description: Examine the role of self-regulating professional bodies (e.g., college, association society, board and council) in the health care field

99855088D2454185B67D26A83B503504.description: Reflect upon personal suitability or non-suitability for a specific health-science related occupation considering criteria such as: initial and continuing educational requirements; duties and skills required for this occupation; the work environment, including typical hours and shifts worked and typical locations; current wages received in Saskatchewan and how these compare to the rest of Canada; physical, mental and emotional stresses related to this occupation; • workplace hazards and safety considerations; other occupations with which they interact;  professional and/or licensing requirements in Canada and Saskatchewan, and; future trends impacting the occupation.

7FC9738858244490AB135A0679C02E7A.description: Examine the roles, responsibilities, educational qualifications and personal and professional qualities common to people involved in health-science related jobs.

A28022A5AB954C10BCE28BCDEC81F565.description: Identify which health-science related occupations are facing shortages and which are oversubscribed locally, regionally and/or nationally.

9C27459F4AD6448FA16757FD874F3A2A.description: Explore the connection between topics in Health Science 20 and occupations of personal interest.

EB91D761D8054B2687E70AB9EE595D4E.description: Generate a list of occupations that require a background in health science through research and/or participation in events such as a career fair or job shadow.

881B8871002D485492CF0400D16AED2E.description: Analyze and explore health-science related occupations in Saskatchewan, Canada and the world.
